image.altText: Rod sitting at a table with a row of four syringes in front of him.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation can reveal several compounding pharmacies and telehealth companies have been quietly selling off-brand versions of the popular weight loss drug Ozempic and shipping them to consumers across Australia.

title.children: 'A loophole that needs to be closed': Pharmacies producing replica Ozempic on an industrial scale

image.altText: A woman with dark short hair and a pink and orange patterned dress squints.

props.synopsis: A new police unit is being established in the Northern Territory to tackle alcohol-fuelled crime, as the government attempts to reassure the public it's devoting resources to addressing antisocial behaviour.

title.children: NT government promises 50 extra police for crime and antisocial behaviour prevention unit

image.altText: A map of northern Australia, with areas highlighted for a chance of a tropical cyclone across far north Queensland and the NT

props.synopsis: The remnants of ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper are expected to move west over the Northern Territory's Top End over the next week, with a 35 per cent chance the system could re-intensify into a cyclone.

title.children: Jasper has 1 in 3 chance of redeveloping in the Gulf of Carpentaria, BOM warns

image.altText: two black and white teen students with backpacks facing away from the camera, another sits behind a computer with their hand up.

props.synopsis: City public primary schools have dominated the list of top-performing schools, according to analysis of NAPLAN data, as school results are released today.Â

title.children: Top-performing schools in each state and territory revealed as state NAPLAN results released

image.altText: Two men stand at press microphones

props.synopsis: Four members of Hamas and three people in Denmark have been arrested on suspicion of planning attacks on Jewish institutions in Europe following a Danish-German investigation.Â

title.children: Hamas members arrested in Germany in association with alleged terror plot

image.altText: A woman being comforted at a press conference

props.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg's lawyer say they will seek significant compensation from the New South Wales government after her convictions were quashed.Â

title.children: Expert 'not surprised' if Kathleen Folbigg receives more than $10 million in compensation

image.altText: David Warner holds his bat up to the crowd as he leaves the field

props.synopsis: With all the attention firmly focused on him, David Warner played a trademark innings that may not satisfy the opener's critics, but goes a long way to reminding them of his immense talent and admirable record.

title.children: David Warner plays the hits in Perth to silence the critics, real and imagined

image.altText: A white male holding his hands in the air, wearing a black suit and maroon tie.

props.synopsis: Offering rare details on Moscow's invasion of Ukraine, Mr Putin dismissed the need for a second wave of mobilisation of reservists.

title.children: 'Real risk': Putin won't stop with Ukraine, says NATO chief, as Russian leader doubles down

image.altText: Aerial shot of an industrial area sitting directly across from a housing estate.

props.synopsis: The EPA launches hundreds of drones across Victorian industrial zones to check for potential fire risks over the summer, but some residents say it's not their only concern.

title.children: 'Like rotting flesh': As housing and industrial areas get closer, residents are concerned about fire risk, health and smell

image.altText: Aerial shot of two workers alongside a crate full of dead fish.

props.synopsis: The Bob Brown Foundation films thousands of dead fish being pumped from the bottom of Tasmanian salmon pens. The owner, Tassal, says the incident is "minor".

title.children: Dead salmon pumped into crates at Tassal pen as environmentalists warn of heatwave

image.altText: colours and numbers light up a gaming machine

props.synopsis: An unexpected level of interest in the NSW government's trial means 28 clubs and hotels, including 4,485 machines, across regional and metro areas, will take part from next year.

title.children: 'The industry is clearly behind us': Cashless gaming trial in NSW expanded to 4,000 poker machines

image.altText: The silhouette of a woman, sitting looking at a smartphone, in the airport lounge with a Qantas plane out the window

props.synopsis: Qantas submits to the federal government's aviation green paper that its recent performance has been "unacceptable".

title.children: Qantas says compensation scheme would hike airline prices

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks annoyed as he addresses the media

props.synopsis: For an issue in which Australia is not a player and has no direct influence, the Israel-Hamas conflict is putting serious strain on the Albanese government, internally and externally, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: Albanese government under more heat as it tries to navigate its position on Gaza conflict

image.altText: A male cricketer slides head-first along the ground, in a green cap, fetching a red ball.

props.synopsis: David Warner makes a gesture just for his critics, Usman Khawaja makes a statement and Pakistan struggles in the field. Here are five quick hits from the first day of the Test series.

title.children: Five quick hits â Warner's unique celebration and Pakistan's shambolic fielding mark day one of the summer

image.altText: A woman stands on the edge of a river, taking a water sample.

props.synopsis: A report reveals unsafe concentrations of pesticides in the Richmond River and its oysters, but agricultural groups say the delay between when the research was conductedÂ and the publication of the findings will make an investigation difficult.

title.children: 'Cocktail of pesticides' â including chemical banned for decades â detected in wild oysters

image.altText: Politician stands in front of parliament in from of media microphones and talks to press

props.synopsis: The NT opposition leader has promised to establish a lobbyist register if her party wins government at next year's territory election. It follows the chief minister being referred to the NT's corruption watchdog over her political adviser's links to gas lobbying.

title.children: NT opposition vows to introduce lobbyist register after chief minister's ICAC referral

image.altText: Outside of Maroochydore courthouse

props.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast court is told the accused is one of three girls who were "active and equal participants" in luring a child into a Tewantin house where she was subjected to a prolonged assault captured on camera.

title.children: Girl, 12, on torture charges a violent drug user likely to reoffend, judge hears

image.altText: Men and women march with crosses, with names of victims, and pictures, for Bloody Sunday

props.synopsis: The only British soldier charged over the Bloody Sunday killings of 13 unarmed Catholic civil rights marchers in 1972 will stand trial for murder.

title.children: British soldier to face murder trial over Northern Ireland's Bloody Sunday shooting

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson in a coral suit.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is suing Lisa Wilkinson and Network Ten over a 2021 The Project interview in which Brittany Higgins alleged she was raped at Parliament House.

title.children: Lisa Wilkinson says she's not a 'cheap, tabloid journalist' as she defends airing Brittany Higgins interview

image.altText: Two men stand in front of microphones in a park on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Authorities express frustration after a magistrate acquitted a 10-year-old boy, who tried to ram a police car in a stolen vehicle, because the child did not adequately grasp the severity of his offending.

title.children: WA government frustrated with magistrate's acquittal of 10yo child who rammed police car

image.altText: A bird flies over a mountain.

props.synopsis: The research shows that the glaciers have been cooling and drying in recent decades.

title.children: Himalayan glaciers are cooling down, potentially slowing down effects of climate change

image.altText: A female bartender smiles at a colleague cutting lemons as she shakes up a cocktail for waiting patrons

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate increases to 3.9 per cent despite the creation of more than 60,000 jobs last month, as the participation rate surges to a fresh record high.

title.children: 'Genuine concerns' as cost-of-living squeeze drives record number of Australians into work

image.altText: a girl holding a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Some devices, including older mobile phones, will no longer be able to get service when Vodafone becomes the first of the three largest telcos to switch its 3G network off.

title.children: Australia's 3G network shutdown begins this Friday. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A man in a red t-shirt and glasses looks directly at the camera while walking outside a court building

props.synopsis: A woman tells an Adelaide court she feared she would never see her family again after a man pretending to be a federal police officer accessed her hotel room and held at her gunpoint after asking to see her immigration papers.

title.children: Fake cop took 'pleasure in seeing how scared he made me', rape victim tells court

image.altText: Alison Maree Virgo and Amy June Collins

props.synopsis: Two directors of a former NDIS provider charged over the death of Adelaide woman Ann Marie Smith, who died while in full-time care, have been committed to stand trial.

title.children: Directors of former NDIS provider to stand trial over death of Ann Marie Smith

image.altText: Milwaukee Bucks NBA player Giannis Antetokounmpo is held back by the jersey as he runs up the hallway after a game.

props.synopsis: Indiana Pacers coach Ric Carlisle says the team's general manager has a bruised rib after copping an elbow in a physical confrontation with Milwaukee Bucks players over who got to keep the ball after the game.

title.children: Wild post-game scenes as Giannis Antetokounmpo scuffles with NBA opponents over who gets to keep game ball

image.altText: Cameron Green smiles as he sits with his pads on during an Australian training session.

props.synopsis: Cameron Green opens up about his condition that at one point had doctors questioning whether he would live past the age of 12.

title.children: Aussie all-rounder Green reveals he's living with 'irreversible' chronic kidney condition

image.altText: A woman looks sad as she looks down the lense of a camera.

props.synopsis: Sally's family has been seeking shelter inside their local church in Gaza for weeks. She says the government's call for a ceasefire is "too little, too late".Â

title.children: Sally, whose family has sought shelter in Gaza church for weeks, deems government's ceasefire call too late

image.altText: A man and woman in front of a brick building

props.synopsis: A country NSW vet saysÂ a student's grades should not be the only criteria for entering the profession as she tries to overcome a staffing crisis.

title.children: Overworked vet says her lack of sleep is typical in an industry struggling to service country communities

image.altText: Two people drag calves by their limbs along an abattoir floor.

props.synopsis: Primary Industries Minister Jo Palmer announces a task force and says kill floor footage at a Tasmanian abattoir showing animals still conscious and alert is "unacceptable".

title.children: Farmers demand immediate CCTV in Tasmanian abattoirs after 'horrific' footage

image.altText: Lemur babies 2

props.synopsis: The black-and-white ruffed lemur triplets will undergo DNA testing after zookeepers at Altina Wildlife Park in southern NSW were caught "very unaware" by their arrival.

title.children: 'Surprise': Three lemurs born out of the blue as search for mystery father begins
